author: James Tanner
method: Heat the oil in a deep heavy-bottomed saucepan, until very hot or until a breadcrumb sizzles in it (CAUTION: Hot oil is very dangerous. Do not leave unattended). Place the flour and sparkling water into a bowl and whisk together to form a batter. Add the chives and turmeric and mix well. Dip the onion rings in the batter and then carefully lower into the hot oil and deep-fry until crisp and golden. Carefully remove with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper. To serve, place onto a serving plate and sprinkle with sea salt.
ingredients: 300ml/½pint vegetable oil, for deep frying,  150g/5½oz self raising flour,  100ml/3½fl oz sparkling water,  45g/3 tbsp fresh chives, chopped,  Pinch turmeric,  1 red onion, peeled and sliced into rings,  Sea salt for sprinkling
